aws_architecture_description: This system is a modern static web application deployed on AWS using Amazon EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service) for container orchestration, with infrastructure as code managed by Terraform and CI/CD handled by Jenkins and GitHub Actions. The application is a static site (HTML, JS, CSS) served by Nginx in a Docker container. The deployment pipeline includes building Docker images, pushing them to a container registry (DockerHub or GHCR), and deploying to EKS. The application is exposed to the internet via an AWS Application Load Balancer (ALB), with all resources securely isolated within a VPC. The architecture follows AWS best practices for security, scalability, and automation, leveraging managed services where possible. Monitoring, logging, and IAM roles are included for operational excellence and least-privilege access control.
aws_resources: Public and Private Subnets (for EKS nodes and ALB)
Security Groups (for EKS nodes, ALB, and control plane)
EKS Node Groups (managed or self-managed EC2 worker nodes)
IAM Roles and Policies (for EKS, nodes, and CI/CD integration)
Amazon ECR (optional, if using AWS-native container registry)
Kubernetes Service of type LoadBalancer (integrated with ALB)
CloudWatch Logs (for EKS and application logging)
VPC Endpoints (optional, for private access to AWS services)
S3 Bucket (optional, for Terraform state or artifacts)
AWS KMS (optional, for encryption of secrets and state)
